meaningMnemonic:
When you <kanji>get a position</kanji> in some <kanji>business</kanji>, you’re considered <vocabulary>working</vocabulary>.

就業 is a formal word that can refer to both <vocabulary>being employed</vocabulary> and <vocabulary>being at work</vocabulary> for the day. It’s commonly used in kanji compounds, such as 就業時間 (working hours) and 就業規則 (employment regulations).
readingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. If you know the readings of your kanji you'll know how to read this as well.
